snippet: Dengue virus appears to make the insects’ antennae more sensitive to odors — making them better at hunting humans, the virus’s only known mammalian host.
abstract: George Dimopoulos study in journal PLoS Pathogens finds that the dengue virus may actually make host mosquitoes thirstier for human blood.
lead_paragraph: Dengue virus appears to make the insects’ antennae more sensitive to odors — making them better at hunting humans, the virus’s only known mammalian host.

headline.seo: Dengue Virus May Make Mosquitoes Thirstier for Human Blood
headline.main: A Virus May Make Mosquitoes Even Thirstier for Human Blood
headline.print_headline: Dengue: A Virus May Make Mosquitoes Even Thirstier for Human Blood
